ygData.subject: Re: Ice Comet
ygData.msgSnippet: Dear Valacian, Good answer. But are you prepared to put it to the test as an experiment? (serious question) I think someone of your level would be appropriate
ygData.messageBody:
Dear Valacian,

Good answer. But are you prepared to put it to the test as an experiment? (serious question) I think
someone of your level would be appropriate to test the wizards power, or lack of it. Would you be
able to cast any spells while he hits you on the head? It's all well and good doing 1100 damage with
an Ice Comet but how long would it take to cast.

PS Well done getting to 22nd level, your right it has to be VERY HARD for us until we reach high
levels.

Valacian wrote:

> I would be MORE than happy to enter an Arena with a duel wield barabrian at the same level as me.
>
> Valacian - 22nd Level Erudite Wizard, Xegony
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Simon Hinshelwood [SMTP:iktome@...]
> Sent: Thursday, May 13, 1999 3:54 PM
> To: eq_wizards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eq_wizards] Ice Comet
>
> From: Simon Hinshelwood <iktome@...>
>
> Well said Jay. Parties cant be bothered with wizards, they cant buff, cant heal
> and cant really help parties that much..."we were supposed to be heavy
> artillery" but that just is not correct. I think a wizard would be most parties
> last choice if they could choose from all the classes.
>
> Its very easy to demonstrate the wizard immbalance; get into an arena with a
> dual wield barbarian warrior of the same level and see how you do!
> Hmm doesn't sound too promising eh?
>
> I have always played a wizard character class in AD&D and UO but I regret
> playing one in EQ. I think EQ were nervous about the power wizards in UO and
> didn't want to unbalance the game. I think they swung the pendalum too far the
> other way. Root 'n' Shoot, if that fails death, thats about it.
>
> Hopefully e-mails will pour in and tell me how wrong I am. Great, show me its
> not the case so I feel I have a character with a future!
>
> Simon
